The Surface Transportation Board must establish regulations for a simplified dispute resolution mechanism within 180 days of this Act. The mechanism involves expedited arbitration with minimal discovery and applies existing legal standards. Decisions must be made within 90 days of appointment, costs are shared equally among parties, decisions are private and not precedential, binding and enforceable, with a right to appeal to the Board. The Surface Transportation Board must establish regulations for a simplified dispute resolution mechanism within 180 days of this Act. Any procedure or regulation adopted by the Board can be modified or eliminated by mutual agreement of all parties involved in the dispute. SEC. 9. PROMOTION OF COMPETITIVE RAIL SERVICE OPTIONS. Amends Section 11324 of title 49, United States Code to encourage and expand competition between rail carriers in affected regions or the national rail system. The Surface Transportation Board may impose conditions to promote competition without causing harm to the benefits of the transaction. SEC. 10. CLARIFICATION OF STB AUTHORITY TO GRANT TEMPORARY ACCESS RELIEF. The Board has the authority to grant temporary relief to remedy inadequate service under sections 10705, 11102, and 11123 of title 49, United States Code. The Board has the authority to grant temporary relief under sections 10705, 11102, and 11123 of title 49, United States Code, in addition to the authority to provide temporary relief under the new section added. SEC. 11. HOUSEHOLD GOODS COLLECTIVE ACTIVITIES: Amends Section 13703(d) of title 49, United States Code regarding agreements related to household goods transportation.

SEC. 12. AUTHORIZATION LEVELS: Authorizes appropriations to the Surface Transportation Board for fiscal years 1999-2002.

SEC. 13. CHAIRMAN DESIGNATED WITH SENATE CONFIRMATION: Amends the process for appointing the Chairman of the Surface Transportation Board.
